dt-api.name: stateRestore.states().delete()

type.parameter: Boolean value indicating if the confirmation modal should be skipped or not.
type.description: Deletes stored states from the StateRestore extension.
type.returns: Returns a DataTables API for chaining.

dt-api.description:
This method provides the ability to delete multiple states that are managed by the `-init stateRestore` extension.
`-api stateRestore.states().delete()` takes one argument, `skipModal` that allows the confirmation modal to be bypassed for each state. It deletes the states retrieved by the previous call to `-api stateRestore.states()`.
A Datatables API is returned so that further chaining can occur.
If the `-init stateRestore.delete` initialisation option is set to `false` then this API method will not do anything.

example.title: Delete states called 'New State' and 'Old State'
